data.text: @2of Where is this big spike coming from

@2of And here comes Wednesday: 185 new cases in one day, highest day in nearly 3 months.  For context, that's 0.22% of IoM population in one day; even benighted UK is only at 0.1% of population today, so we're more than twice as bad.  "Living with Covid", @alfredcannan @LawrieHooper ?

@birthwing @2of It is mind boggling that is the case hearing of all these IOM kids disabled by their Covid infections. Unless it changes, sadly many more will be affected by preventable disability - including those kids already disabled getting worse with reinfection.
@2of This is exactly what I find amusing: the same  ‘fact’ presented from the alternate view is taken completely differently by the same people.
@loveandpeaceal2 @2of Less than a dozen masks school-wide here...

@2of @WBruchal One would just hope if infected it happens before too much wane kicks in.... On other side, UK PH mass Summer infection program which reduces NHS Winter pressures going according to plan.

@2of Know of people who have had Covid for 12 to 15 days and have had a really rough time.  Worrying thing is knowing people who say that because the Government says they can go out after 10 days, even if still positive, they stop testing and head back into normal life maskless!

@birthwing @2of Not sure what IOM mask wearing in school buildings is looking like tho guessing worse than previous - looks like it may spread very quickly, esp if BA.2 as it's considerably more transmissible than BA.1 Huge viral load in comparison too.
